migDataDictionary.ddName: Barnes (Albert H.) Photographs of Western Washington

definition.para: A name given to the resource.

instructions.para: A brief descriptive phrase that includes these elements, generally in this order: who, what, where, when.

The Title is a concise sentence which will be used to label the thumbnails in CONTENTdm; it will also be the first line of the descriptive information. The Title may be the caption assigned by the photographer or the collector, or it may be created by Special Collections staff from the given caption and from additional sources. In the absence of any caption, the Title will be provided by Special Collections staff.
If the caption provided by the photographer is adequate, place it in the Title field. Then, the Notes field should include this phrase: Title taken from photograph.
If the caption provided by the photographer is inadequate, a created title should be placed in the Title field; the Notes field should then read: Caption on image: "Image title."

If there is a series caption, it should be added, in the Notes field, in sequence after the title on the image: Caption on image: "Image title"; "Series title." There should also be a separate notation in the Notes field in the form: Part of Hegg series entitled: "Series title."
A brief descriptive phrase that includes these elements, generally in this order: who, what, where, when.

The Title is a concise sentence which will be used to label the thumbnails for the compound objects in CONTENTdm; it will also be the first line of the descriptive information. The Title may be a caption assigned by a photographer/creator/contributor or the collector, or it may be created by Special Collections staff from the given caption and from additional sources. In the absence of any caption, the Title will be provided by Special Collections staff.

If the caption provided by a photographer/creator/contributor is adequate, place it in the Title field. Then, the Notes field should include a phrase like this: "Title taken from photograph" or "Title taken from text attached to resource."

If the caption provided by a photographer/creator/contributor is inadequate, a created title should be placed in the Title field; the Notes field should then read something like: 'Caption on image: "Image title" ' or 'Title provided by University of Washington Libraries staff.'

If there is a series caption, it should be added in the Notes field; the note should begin "Series Title: "; the note should be in sequence after the notes describing the title (for example, the 'Caption on image: "Image title" ' note). There should also be a separate notation in the Notes field in the form: Part of Hegg series entitled: "Series title."
Every page must have a title.

Enter a title for the single item/page. This could be a descriptive title for the content of the item, a transcribed title, or a title that helps administer the overall object, whatever works best for the project.

customization.para: Enter a descriptive title, minimally stating the name of the building (or proposed building), a description of the drawing (for example, "interior details"), and a description of the area of the building represented in the drawing (for example, "ground floor entrance and corridor").
All items must have a title.
Enter a brief descriptive phrase. Do not use initial articles, if possible.
Construct as follows: [Name of interviewee] interview
All items must have a title.
Enter a brief descriptive phrase. Do not use initial articles, if possible.
Construct as follows: [Name of interviewee] interview, [item format]

example.para: Alger house, interior view of living room Seattle, Washington, 1955
Woman mushing wood, Chilkoot Trail, ca. 1898
Lyman Whitney Strong Jr. letter to his brother Arthur Tappan Strong, February 23, 1862

customization.para: White Building (Seattle, Wash.), interior details for the ground floor entrance and corridor
Albert S. Kerry residence (Seattle, Wash.), dining room details
B.P.O. Elk's Lodge (Centralia, Wash.), Pearl Street elevation
Bjarne Moe student drawing of a commemorative tablet
Michael Sullivan interview
Michael Sullivan interview, audio
Michael Sullivan interview, transcript
Michael Sullivan interview, photograph

dcgNotes.para: Indicators must be set manually to 00.
Former profile also mapped to 520_8#_$a, "Summary." This mapping no longer used.

rdf.localNote: We are claiming that our local title is always a Dublin Core title, although a Dublin Core title may not always be a local title; similarly are claiming that each local title is a VRA name and, by extension, a schema.org name, but not all such names are local titles.

history.justification: For CONTENTdm collections; all CONTENTdm collections require titles.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.
added info for uwtoh

definition.para: The photographer or firm associated with the creation of the image

instructions.para: Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names. Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.

Enter the name of the photographer or firm associated with the creation of the image in hand. It should represent as closely as possible the creator’s name or the company’s name at the time of the creation of the image. Can be the same entry as in the Studio Name field. Includes both personal and corporate names.
Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names. Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.

Enter the name of the photographer or firm associated with the creation of the image(s) contained in the resource. It should represent as closely as possible the creator’s name or the company’s name at the time of the creation of the image(s). Can be the same entry as in the Studio Name field. Includes both personal and corporate names.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon.

customization.para: Noegel, Scott B.

history.justification: Every photo has a photographer. Photographer is the creator; labeling the property "Photographer" instead of "Creator" identifies the role of the creator.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Date of creation of the original resource.

instructions.para: Reflects the date in the "Date" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
Most recent version of EDTF available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Six formats are recommended for values in Date, each corresponding to a specific EDTF format:
If the value of Date is YYYY, enter YYYY.
If the value of Date is YYYY?, enter YYYY?
If the value of Date is [month] DD, YYYY, enter YYYY-MM-DD.
If the value of Date is [month], YYYY, enter YYYY-MM.
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY, enter YYYY/YYYY
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY?, enter YYYY?/YYYY?
If the value of Date is not any of the above, consult the EDTF spedification to determine the appropriate notation.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.
Reflects the date in the "Date" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
Most recent version of EDTF available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Six formats are recommended for values in Date, each corresponding to a specific EDTF format:
If the value of Date is YYYY, enter YYYY.
If the value of Date is YYYY, enter YYYY?
If the value of Date is [month] DD, YYYY, enter YYYY-MM-DD.
If the value of Date is [month], YYYY, ebter YYYY-MM.
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY, enter YYYY/YYYY
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY, enter YYYY?/YYYY?
If the value of Date is not any of the above, consult the EDTF spedification to determine the appropriate notation.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.

customization.para: Enter the date of the execution of the drawing.
Reflects the date in the "Date" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
Most recent version of EDTF available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.

example.para: If the Date field = "1940" then Date EDTF = "1940"
If the Date field = "1910?" then Date EDTF = "1910?"
If Date field = "May 9, 2001" then Date EDTF = "2001-05-09"
If Date field = "January 2008" then Date EDTF = "2008-01"
If Date field = "between 1930 and 1939" then Date EDTF = "1930/1939"
If Date field = "between 1855 and 1999?" then Date EDTF = "1855?/1999?"
If the Date field = "1940" then Date EDTF = "1940"
If the Date field = "1910?" then Date EDTF = "1910?"
If Date field = "May 9, 2001" then Date EDTF = "2001-05-09"
If Date field = "January 2008" then Date EDTF = "2008-01"
If Date field = "between 1930 and 1939" then Date EDTF = "1930/1939"
If Date field = "between 1855 and 1999?" then Date EDTF = "1855?/1999?"

admin.para: This document needs a reference to the final spec.

For the xsd, datatype is xs:string; the datatype is more accurately http://id.loc.gov/datatypes/edtf, which is not a valid QName and is inavlid according to schema-4-properties, but this does not seem to be machine-actionable; more exploration needed.

generalNotes.para: EDTF is still a standard in progress. It has not yet been accpted as a full recommendation. It should be voted on in 2018 by ISO. We are anticipating it will becoming a 2-part ISO 8601-2018.

history.justification: Wanted to add standardized date forms (EDTF) required by Orbis Cascade Dublin Core Best Practices (https://www.orbiscascade.org/dublin-core-best-practices).

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation. Also updated link to EDTF and added some instructions.

definition.para: Date of creation of the original resource.

instructions.para: If the resource is a photograph, the date the original photograph was taken.
In cases where a painting, engraving, or architectural drawing was photographed, the date the artwork was created.
Enter the date using one of the following formats:
YYYY
YYYY?
[month spelled out] [day], YYYY
[month spelled out], YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY?
In CONTENTdm, this field is used for display purposes only and should be user-friendly.
Date value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Dates fields.
If the date when the image/resource in hand was produced is known, and is different from that of the original image, so note in the Notes field.
If the date is unknown, enter an approximate date using one of the two above formats that express uncertainty, namely YYYY? or between YYYY and YYYY?.
If none of the date formats above are adequate, use a custom date format.
If the resource is a photograph, the date the original photograph was taken.
In cases where a painting, engraving, or architectural drawing was photographed, the date the artwork was created.
Enter the date using one of the following formats:
YYYY
YYYY?
[month spelled out] [day], YYYY
[month spelled out], YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY?
In CONTENTdm, this field is used for display purposes only and should be user-friendly.
Date value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Dates fields.
If the date when the image/resource in hand was produced is known, and is different from that of the original image, so note in the Notes field.
If the date is unknown, enter an approximate date using one of the two above formats that express uncertainty, namely YYYY? or between YYYY and YYYY?.
If none of the date formats above are adequate, use a custom date format.

customization.para: Enter the date of the execution of the drawing.

[month spelled out] [day], YYYY

between YYYY and YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY?
In CONTENTdm, this field is used for display purposes only and should be user-friendly.
Date value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Dates fields.
If the date is unknown, enter an approximate date using one of the two above formats that express uncertainty, namely YYYY? or between YYYY and YYYY?.
If none of the date formats above are adequate, use a custom date format.
Enter the creation date of the item. For most items this will be the date on which the interview took place.
If the interview took place over an extended period of time, enter the range of dates.
Enter the date using one of the following formats:
YYYY
YYYY?
[month spelled out] [day], YYYY
[month spelled out], YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY
between YYYY and YYYY?
In CONTENTdm, this field is used for display purposes only and should be user-friendly.
Date value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Dates fields.
If the date is unknown, enter an approximate date using one of the two above formats that express uncertainty, namely YYYY? or between YYYY and YYYY?.
If none of the date formats above are adequate, use a custom date format.

example.para: 1940? [this expresses a probable year, an uncertain year, etc.]
1940? [this expresses a probable year, an uncertain year, etc.]

history.justification: We need a display dates field that will be easy for users to understand. It does not need to be indexed but it seems OK to map to Dublin Core.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation. Also added instruction.
Added customix=zations for Architecture of the Pacific Northwest collection.

definition.para: Date of creation of the original resource.

instructions.para: Reflects the date in the "Date" field.
Enter the year or years only.
When the value of Date is YYYY, enter YYYY.
When the value of Date is YYYY?, enter an eleven year date range, five years on either side of the uncertain date.
When the value of Date is [month] DD, YYYY, enter the year only in the following format: YYYY.
When the value of Date is [month], YYYY, enter the year only in the following format: YYYY.
When the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY, enter all years in the date range in the following format: YYYY YYYY YYYY etc.

When the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY?, enter all years in the date range plus five years before the earliest date and five years after the latest date, in the following format: YYYY YYYY YYYY etc.
This field is indexed and enables date searching in CONTENTdm.
The Dates value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Date fields.
Reflects the date in the "Date" field.
Enter the year or years only.
When the value of Date is YYYY, enter YYYY.
When the value of Date is YYYY?, enter an eleven year date range, five years on either side of the uncertain date.
When the value of Date is [month] DD, YYYY, enter the year only in the following format: YYYY.
When the value of Date is [month], YYYY, enter the year only in the following format: YYYY.
When the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY, enter all years in the date range in the following format: YYYY YYYY YYYY etc.

When the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY?, enter all years in the date range plus five years before the earliest date and five years after the latest date, in the following format: YYYY YYYY YYYY etc.
This field is indexed and enables date searching in CONTENTdm.
The Dates value should agree with date values entered in Date-Edtf and Date fields.

customization.para: Enter the date of the execution of the drawing.
Enter the year or years only.

history.justification: We need a field that can be indexed in CONTENTdm in a way that allows all the years in a date range to be indexed. It should not be mapped to a Dublin Core property and it should be hidden from the public.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation. Added an instruction.
Changed instructions to state that this field should merely reflect the "Date" field.

definition.para: Reflects the Date field, treating all Date values as date ranges. The value in this field is the earliest date in the date range.

instructions.para: If the date is a single year, it is the same in both the Date and the Earliest Date fields.
If the date in the Date field is a "circa" date (e.g. ca. 1895), the Earliest Date field contains the first date in the date range, in ISO 8601 format (YYYY, or YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD as needed).

example.para: If the Date field = "1940," Earliest Date = "1940"
If the Date field = "ca. 1910," Earliest Date = "1905"

admin.para: All values for this field should be ISO 8601 compliant.

history.justification: Wanted to add standardized date forms (ISO 8601) in all collections.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Reflects the Date field, treating all Date values as date ranges. The value in this field is the latest date in the date range.

instructions.para: If the date is a single year, it is the same in both the Date and the Latest Date fields.
If the date in the Date field is a "circa" date (e.g. ca. 1895), the Latest Date field contains the last date in the date range, in ISO 8601 format (YYYY, or YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD as needed).

example.para: If the Date field = "1940," Latest Date = "1940"
If the Date field = "ca. 1910," Latest Date = "1915"

admin.para: All values for this field should be ISO 8601 compliant.

history.justification: Wanted to add standardized date forms (ISO 8601) in all collections.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: An account of the resource.

instructions.para: Enter any information of importance that is not represented elsewhere.
Each separate "note" should be a paragraph. Additional notes can be added, separated from the previous note using a blank line.
Enter any information of importance that is not represented elsewhere.
Each separate "note" should be a paragraph. Additional notes can be added, separated from the previous note using a blank line.

customization.para: An account of the drawing.
Notes include any information of importance that is not represented elsewhere.
Enter any descriptive narrative information of importance about the project and its subjects that is not recorded elsewhere.
Each separate "note" should be a paragraph. Additional notes can be added, separated from the previous note using a blank line.

example.para: Photographs taken by Asahel Curtis during his trip to the Klondike in 1897-1899.
Handwritten on verso: Mrs. McLain with dog team.
Photographs taken by Asahel Curtis during his trip to the Klondike in 1897-1899.
Handwritten on verso: Mrs. McLain with dog team.

customization.para: Handwritten in title block: Apartment house. Osborn, Architect. 325 Leary Bldg., Seattle, Wash. E.C.R. [drawn by?]
Handwritten beneath drawing: First floor plan. Scale: 1/16" to 1'
Plans for a frame hotel to be erected by the Lake View Land Co. at Lakeview, Wash.
Stamped on cover sheet: Farrell and Darmer, Architects, Tacoma, Wash. Ter.
From inventory: (1890)
Residence for Mr. C.J. Lord

Written in title block: Residence for Mr. C.J. Lord; 21st and Columbia Streets, Olympia, Washington; Basement and Foundation plan; Joseph H. Wohleb, Architect. Olympia, Wash.; Drawn by Y.D.W.; Traced by W.W.; Date Feb. 1923;Comm. No. 251; Sheet no. 2; Scale: 1/4" to 1'
The oral history interview with Michal Sullivan was part of the “Founding Stories” phase of the UW Tacoma Oral History Project.

generalNotes.para: "Notes" is distingushed from "Historical Notes" mainly because it descibes the image/resource only. Values in this field also may be considered more "indexable" insofar as they precisely descibe the image/resource. "HistoricalNotes" are more like "writing" and create a broad historical context.

history.justification: Needed a place to enter all "other" information valuable to the description of the resource.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.
Added customization for Architecture of the Pacific Northwest.

definition.para: The topic of the resource.

instructions.para: Terms in this field are taken from the LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
Terms in this field are taken from the LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.

customization.para: Leave empty; UW Libraries catalogers will provide LSCH subjects.
Terms in this field will be taken from the LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
Multiple headings will be separated with a semi-colon.

history.justification: We wanted a subject field that distinguishes TGM headings from other subject headings, to get the full benefits of using a controlled vocabulary.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: The topic of the resource.

instructions.para: Values for this property are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
For images, use LCSH only when TGM has no appropriate term to describe the resource.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.
Values in this property are taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
For images, use LCSH only when TGM has no appropriate term to describe the resource.
Separate multiple headings with a semi-colon.

customization.para: Leave empty; UW Libraries catalogers will provide LSCH subjects.
Be sure to enter the value "xyz" in the "Cataloging" field to alert catalogers that these items need subject headings.
Values for this property will be taken from the LC Subject Headings list (LCSH) at http://authorities.loc.gov or http://id.loc.gov.
Multiple headings will be separated with a semi-colon.
topical headings and headings for places with proper names which are not entered in the Geographic Coverage field below (this includes neighborhoods) will be entered here..

history.justification: We wanted a subject field that distinguishes LCSH headings from other subject headings, to get the full benefits of using a controlled vocabulary.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: The spatial characteristics of the resource; refers to a physical region.

instructions.para: Enter broad and local geographic locations given significant attention in the resource.
Enter Country--State or Province--City.
Forms of the names should be derived from the LC Authority File.
For neighborhoods or other types of locales below the city level, enter an LCSH heading in the Subjects (LCSH) field above.
Separate multiple entries with a semicolon .
Enter broad and local geographic locations given significant attention in the resource.
Enter Country--State or Province--City.
Places names are derived from the LC Authority File.
For neighborhoods or other types of locales below the city level, enter an LCSH heading in the Subjects (LCSH) field above.
Separate multiple entries with a semicolon .

example.para: Croatia--Zagreb [use current form, even though Yugoslavia was the name when the photo was taken]
Russia (Federation)--Leningradskaia oblast--Saint Petersburg [use current form, even though it was called Leningrad in Soviet Union, when photo was taken]

admin.para: SC Photographs collections DD uses the label "Location Depicted." SC Oral Histories DD uses the label "Geographic Coverage." Both properties appear to be equivalent.

history.justification: We wanted a property dedicated to describing the location depicted in an image.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Instructions for ordering.

instructions.para: Enter the instructions for ordering. If the item cannot be ordered, state that it cannot be ordered.
Enter the instructions for ordering. If the item cannot be ordered, state that it cannot be ordered.

customization.para: Enter the instructions for ordering.

Enter: "To request a high resolution or uncompressed reproduction, or to obtain permission to use any portion of this item, contact University of Washington Tacoma Library. Email: taclibdc@uw.edu. Please reference the Digital ID Number."

example.para: To order a reproduction, inquire about permissions, or for information about prices see: http://www.lib.washington.edu/specialcollections/services/reproduction/reproduction.
To order a reproduction, inquire about permissions, or for information about prices see: http://www.lib.washington.edu/specialcollections/services/reproduction/reproduction.

customization.para: To request a high resolution or uncompressed reproduction, or to obtain permission to use any portion of this item, contact University of Washington Tacoma Library. Email: taclibdc@uw.edu. Please reference the Digital ID Number.

admin.para: The text for this field will be unique to each project, and should be created by the project manager for any given project.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted all items to have ordering instructions.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Brief citation/identifier format for the resource.

instructions.para: Enter citation format information in accordance with the procedure developed in UW Libraries Special Collections.
Enter a citation format for the resource using only the following elements: (1) name of organization, (2) name of department, (3) the text "[Order Number or Negative Number]."

customization.para: Enter a citation for the resource using only the following elements: (1) name of organization, (2) name of department, (3) the text "[Digital ID Number]."

example.para: University of Washington Libraries, Special Collections, [Order Number or Negative Number]
University of Washington Libraries, Special Collections, [Order Number or Negative Number]

customization.para: University of Washington Libraries, University of Washington Tacoma Library, [Digital ID Number]

admin.para: Definition, instructions and examples not approved by Special Collections.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted an effective identifier for users to identify resources, especially when ordering items.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.
Expanded instructions to include uwt-oh. Added examples using current values. Wrote a more specific definition but not sure its accurate!

definition.para: The Negative number refers to the reproduction number assigned to the image for purposes of duplication. It is the unique number by which Special Collections identifies the image. It may be identical to another number in the record.

instructions.para: Enter the negative number. If two negatives numbers are associated with an image, these are to be separated by a semicolon.

history.justification: Special Collections needed a place to record the negative number.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: The institution holding the resource.

instructions.para: Enter the name of the institution in which the original item is held.
Enter the name of the institution in which the original item is held.

definition.para: This field contains the URI to the EAD finding aid.

instructions.para: Enter only the URI to the EAD finding aid.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: The nature or genre of the resource.

instructions.para: Input a term or terms taken from a controlled source. Recommended: LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the thesaurus.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.
Input a term taken from a controlled source. Recommended: LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials (still images), Library of Congress Subject Headings (oral histories).
If more than one term is applicable, list the form of the item digitaized first.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the controlled source.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.
Optional: input a term taken from a controlled source. Recommended: LC Thesaurus for Graphic Materials (still images), Library of Congress Subject Headings (oral histories).
Not required for all compound object items. Use as needed. Recommended: enter type values when the collection resources are mixed media.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the controlled source.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.

customization.para: Input a term taken from the Art and Architecture Thesaurus at http://www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabularies/aat/.
Recommended but not required for all compound object items.
Especially important to enter when the collection resources are mixed media.
Enter the heading exactly as it appears in the controlled source.
Separate multiple values with a semi-colon and space.

Enter "Oral histories"

example.para: Typescript; Diary [typescript made from manuscript diary]
Typescript; Diary [typescript made from manuscript diary]
Negatives [a collection of negatives described as a collection]
Typescript; Diary [typescript made from manuscript diary]

customization.para: Oral histories
Oral histories

admin.para: There's a difference between SC DDs for photograph collections and oral history collections; the former uses "Object Type," the latter uses "Genre." Proposal: "Object Type" applies to all resources more than "Genre." Let's use "Object Type" in all cases, as here.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted a description of the resource type.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

Saw a difference between SC DDs for photograph collections and oral history collections; the former uses "Object Type," the latter uses "Genre." Merged the two and tried to make the property properties apply more generally.
Added info for uwtoh.

definition.para: The physical medium in which data, sound, images, etc., are stored; the carrier; may include an extent statement.

instructions.para: Input a term describing the physical medium of the original resource in which data, sound, images, etc., are stored.
The term should be taken from an authoritative source.
Recommended source: RDA chapter 3, especually 3.3.
Former recommended source: Graphic Materials: Rules for Describing Original Items and Historical Collections. Use of this source is no longer recommended.
Entry may include an extent statement, dimensions, base material, or any other carrier description, as described in detail in RDA chapter 3.
Input a term describing the physical medium of the original resource in which data, sound, images, etc., are stored.
The term should be taken from an authoritative source.
Recommended source: RDA 3.3 and 3.4.
Former recommended source: Graphic Materials: Rules for Describing Original Items and Historical Collections. Use of this source is no longer recommended.
Entry may include an extent statement, dimensions, base material, or any other carrier description, as described in detail in RDA chapter 3.
Input a term describing the physical medium of the original resource in which data, sound, images, etc., are stored.
The term should be taken from an authoritative source.
Recommended source: RDA 3.3 and 3.4.
Former recommended source: Graphic Materials: Rules for Describing Original Items and Historical Collections. Use of this source is no longer recommended.
Entry may include an extent statement, dimensions, base material, or any other carrier description, as described in detail in RDA chapter 3.
When the original format is one digital file, enter "1 online resource" or just "online resource."

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

Improved definition; added item info.

definition.para: Description of the digital conversion process, date scanned, etc.

instructions.para: Input a paragraph with pertinent information on the digital conversion process.
Input a paragraph with pertinent information on the digital conversion process of the overall object.
Input a paragraph with pertinent information on the digital conversion process of the compound object item.

example.para: Scanned from a photographic print using a Microtek Scanmaker 9600XL at 72 dpi in JPEG format at compression rate 3. 10/1998.
Scanned from original text or image at 400 dpi saved in TIFF format, resized and enhanced using Adobe Photoshop, and imported as JPEG2000 using Contentdm software's JPEG2000 Extension. 2006.
Scanned from original text or image at 400 dpi saved in TIFF format, resized and enhanced using Adobe Photoshop, and imported as JPEG2000 using Contentdm software's JPEG2000 Extension. 2006.

history.justification: Special Collections wanted a description of the digitization process.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.
Added item info.

definition.para: City of publication in which the photographer/publisher worked at the time the image was printed.

instructions.para: If the studio location is noted on the front of the photograph, or is known to the cataloger, it is provided in Studio Location field.
Input in standard hierarchical form separated by a dash (equivalent to two hyphens).
If there is more than one studio location noted, separate them by semi-colons.

history.justification: Special Collections believed representing studio location was useful information, so we created this property.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Name of the photographer or firm, artist, or architect associated with the creation of the original image.

instructions.para: This field to be used only if the entry in the Photographer field does not represent the original creator of the image.
This field should represent as closely as possible the creator’s name or the company’s name at the time of the creation of the original image.
Includes both personal and corporate names.
Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names. Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.

history.justification: Special Collections found that distinguishing the original creator was needed so frequently that we created a property for it.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: Name of the studio and/or publisher of the photograph.

instructions.para: If the studio name/publisher of the photograph on hand is known, it is provided in the Studio Name field. This is often identical to the entry in the Photographer field.
Input the name of the studio.
Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names. Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.

history.justification: Special Collections needed a property to describe the name of the studio that at some point disseminated the photograph.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: UW Library's reference number for the photographer.

instructions.para: Input along with photographer's name; usually linked with the entry in the Photographer field.

generalNotes.para: The Photographer's Reference Number along with the name of the photographer provides a unique identification for the image.

history.justification: Special Collections not only wanted to record the photographer's reference number but to use it to assemble a unique identifier for the item.

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation.

definition.para: A person or organization not specified in the Creator field or Photographer field who has made a significant contribution to the resource, but whose contribution is secondary to any person or organization specified in the Creator field.

instructions.para: Input name of the contributor.
Use LC Authority File for form of name, if available.
Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names.

Input Lastname, Firstname for all personal names.

definition.para: URI that dereferences to a rights statement.

instructions.para: Enter a rights statement from rightsstatements.org.

UW Libraries Special Collections policy: for items with a date later than 1922, enter http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC/1.0/ ("In Copyright"); for all else enter http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/CNE/1.0/ ("Copyright Not Evaluated.")
Enter a rights statement from rightsstatements.org that pertains to the entire object.

UW Libraries Special Collections policy: for items with a date later than 1922, enter http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC/1.0/ ("In Copyright"); for all else enter http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/CNE/1.0/ ("Copyright Not Evaluated.")

customization.para: Enter the following URI from rightsstatements.org: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC-EDU/1.0/ .
http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC-EDU/1.0/

history.justification: Wanted a machine-actionable rights statement, and the property allows us to be compliant with Orbis Cascade Alliance Dublin Core Best Practices at first experimental harvest in June 2017.

Does not appear to be searchable in the cdm collection; it does not appear to be an indexed field.

It does appear to be the persistent URI for the resource (in its context; not a uri for the actual resource, the image); however the reference URI outputs perfectly in OAI-PMH; it outputs however in cdm exports with port 80 added to the base URI (http://cdm16786.contentdm.oclc.org:80/).
